Package tools.io

Class BufferedReaderPlus

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • java.io.BufferedReader
        • tools.io.BufferedReaderPlus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Readable
    public class BufferedReaderPlus
extends java.io.BufferedReader
implements java.io.Closeable
    Provides an easy way of processing a data file. Has the following functionality:
    • Keeps track of a line counter.
    • Supports custom comment (single line and multiple line).
    • Supports CSV file handling:
      • Format: data;data;data; (etc.)
      • Read single cell.
      • Read line of cells.
    • Supports config file handling:
      • Format: name=data,data,data (etc.)
      • Read name field.
      • Read data field.
      • Changeable delimiters for name and data fields.
    • Supports stream marking.
    • Supports easy pre and post line processing for extended classes.
    • Can be used as a wrapper for readers.

      • readCSVCell

        public java.lang.String readCSVCell()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a processed cell from a csv file.
        Note:
        If no line was buffered, pick the next one iff lineBlock == false. Otherwise return null.
        Returns:
        The data of a single cell from the file. Returns null iff EOF reached or if lineBlock == true and EOL reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Iff the data could not be retrieved from the file.
        See Also:
        readCSVCell(boolean), readCSVCell(boolean, boolean)

      • readCSVCell

        public java.lang.String readCSVCell​(boolean processed)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a processed cell from a csv file.
        Note:
        If no line was buffered, pick the next one iff lineBlock == false. Otherwise return null.
        Parameters:
        processed - Whether to use processed lines as input or not. Default is true.
        Returns:
        The data of a single cell from the file. Returns null iff EOF reached or if lineBlock == true and EOL reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Iff the data could not be retrieved from the file.
        See Also:
        readCSVCell(boolean, boolean)

      • readCSVCell

        public java.lang.String readCSVCell​(boolean processed,
                                    boolean lineBlock)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a processed cell from a csv file.
        Note:
        If no line was buffered, pick the next one iff lineBlock == false. Otherwise return null.
        Parameters:
        processed - Whether to use processed lines as input or not. Default is true.
        lineBlock - Whether to return null if the end of a line has been reached (true), or to take the next line (false).
        Returns:
        The data of a single cell from the file. Returns null iff EOF reached or if lineBlock == true and EOL reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Iff the data could not be retrieved from the file.

      • readCSVLine

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> readCSVLine​(boolean processed)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads either all remaining processed cells on the buffered line or all cells on a new line from a csv file.
        Note:
        If no line was buffered, pick the next one iff lineBlock == false. Otherwise return null.
        Parameters:
        processed - Whether to use processed lines as input or not.
        Returns:
        The data of each cell in an array in increasing order. Returns null iff EOF reached or if lineBlock == true and EOL reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - iff the data could not be retrieved from the file.

        See Also:
        readCSVLine(boolean, boolean)

      • readCSVLine

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> readCSVLine​(boolean processed,
                                                    boolean lineBlock)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads either all remaining processed cells on the buffered line or all cells on a new line from a csv file.
        Note:
        If no line was buffered, pick the next one iff lineBlock == false. Otherwise return null.
        Parameters:
        processed - Whether to use processed lines as input or not.
        lineBlock - Whether to return null if the end of the line has been reached (true), or to take the next line (false).
        Returns:
        The data of each cell in an array in increasing order. Returns null iff EOF reached or if lineBlock == true and EOL reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Iff the data could not be retrieved from the file.

      • readNextConfLine

        public boolean readNextConfLine()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next field.
        Returns:
        true if EOF was not yet reached. false if EOF was reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - iff the data could not be retrieved from the file.
        See Also:
        readNextConfLine(boolean)

      • readNextConfLine

        public boolean readNextConfLine​(boolean processed)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next field. The field name can be retrieved via getField() and the data can be retrieved via getData().
        Parameters:
        processed - Whether to use processed lines as input or not. Default is true.
        Returns:
        true If EOF was not yet reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Iff the data could not be retrieved from the file.

      • getField

        public java.lang.String getField()
        Getter for a data field.
        Returns:
        The name of the field, or null if no previous field was available (not yet started or EOF).

      • fieldEquals

        public boolean fieldEquals​(java.lang.String name)
        Helper function for testing if fields are equal.
        More specifically, true is returned if, and only if, name == null ? field == null : name.equals(field).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the field to check for.
        Returns:
        true iff the given name equals the current field. false otherwise.

      • getData

        public java.lang.String[] getData()
        Getter for confData.
        Returns:
        Array containing the values of the field. null if no values available, and an empty array if no previous data available (not yet started or EOF).

      • getData

        public java.lang.String getData​(int i)
        Getter for ith item of the data.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the element to be returned.
        Returns:
        The element of the values of the field at the provided index. null if no values available or if the index is not within the range of the values array.

      • mark

        public void mark​(int readAheadLimit)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Marks the present location in the steam. After reading readAheadLimit characters, attempting to reset the stream may fail.
        Overrides:
        mark in class java.io.BufferedReader
        Parameters:
        readAheadLimit - number of characters that will be at most read before reset() is called.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the current reader is not initialized for stream marking.
        See Also:
        reset()

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Resets to the last marked point in the stream.
        Overrides:
        reset in class java.io.BufferedReader
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the current reader is not initialized for stream marking.
        See Also:
        mark(int)
